system.description:
You gain the ability to encode physical objects into text for later retrieval.

Using calligrapher’s supplies, you can convert a physical object into pages of text, which you can then retrieve by reading. In order to be eligible for this, the object cannot be bulky. The pages must all be in the same volume and must be contiguous. See the table for the time and pages of text required for various object types. Magical artifacts cannot be stored this way. Objects can be scribed into blank pages in a spellbook, if desired. Retrieving the object erases the text on the pages and makes the space usable again. An object stored this way is considered to be on a different plane and the text does not register as magical to spells or other effects that detect magic. Only you can retrieve items you have stored this way.

Item Type Time to Scribe/Retrieve Number of Pages Required
Mundane object 1 action/1 bonus action 1
Common, uncommon, or rare magic item 1 minute/1 action 10
Very rare or legendary magic item 10 minutes/1 action 100
